author: Colin Bowles
title: Hokies fall in 4 OT
text:
Hokies fall in 4 OT - WVVA TV Bluefield Beckley WV News, Weather and Sports Member Center: Hokies fall in 4 OT Posted: BLACKSBURG, VA - 
(WVVA) 
Duke's Thomas Sirk threw four touchdown passes and ran for a 2-point conversion in the fourth overtime to lift 23rd ranked Duke to a win over Virginia Tech, 45-43 Saturday night. 
The Hokies trailed almost all game, but two long second-half scoring drives that tied the game. The teams had traded field goals, then touchdowns, then field goals again through the first three overtimes until Sirk converted the 2-point conversion. 
Michael Brewer started his first game sine week one and threw for three touchdowns while converting 24 of his 45 passes for 270 yards. Breden Motley did play briefly with his only pass falling incomplete. 
Virginia Tech ended with 452 total yards. 
The Hokies fall to 3-5 and will travel to Boston College on Saturday.
